content:

title: The hidden human cost of Artificial Intelligence
description: AI systems rely on human labour from developing countries for data annotation, training, and quality control, raising concerns about exploitation.
content: The world is gearing towards an ‘automated economy’ where machines relying on artificial intelligence (AI) systems produce quick, efficient and nearly error-free outputs. However, AI is not getting smarter on its own; it has been built on and continu... [4825 chars]

title: China Tech Stocks Surge to 2021 Level as Investors Bet on AI
description: Chinese technology stocks listed in Hong Kong jumped to their highest level in almost four years as optimism over artificial intelligence fueled demand.
content:

title: Here’s how the AI bubble could pop
description: Investors think stocks are overvalued, but they’re backing the artificial intelligence boom anyway. However, GQG Partners says they should follow the money.
content:

title: Indian VCs go independent amid wider churn in early
description: A change of guard is underway in Indian venture capital, as seasoned general partners (GPs) exit marquee funds to launch leaner, nimbler firms, ushering a generational churn in early-stage investing. The push by senior partners to go solo comes amid a broader reset in venture investing. Large exits have been sparse, and the artificial intelligence frenzy that has swept global markets has largely eluded India, leaving tech-focussed VCs in a state of uncertainty.
